New Records: South Africa recorded their highest score of 357-4 in the match
Keshav Maharaj claimed four wickets, the most by a South African bowler in the match
Key Match Events: South Africa's 200-run partnership for the second wicket
New Zealand's heaviest defeat in World Cup history
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted South Africa as strong contenders given their batting strength
South Africa opted to bat first to capitalize on their strong top-order
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand captain Tom Latham acknowledged the team's poor performance and lack of partnerships
South Africa's players and coach praised the team's collective effort
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Pune, South Africa's stronghold
South Africa's victory opened up opportunities for other teams in the tournament
Others: The match was a significant milestone for South Africa's World Cup campaign
New Zealand's struggles with their middle order were a key factor
